maml:description.maml:para: Get one or more Availability Group Listeners in a SQL Virtual Machine Group.
The Get-AzAvailabilityGroupListener gets one or more Availability Group Listener from the SQL Virtual Machine Group.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the resource group.
SQL virtual machine group name.
Availability Group Listener name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
SQL virtual machine Group object.
Availability Group Listener name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Availability Group Listener Resource Id
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Availability Group Listener name.
The name of the resource group.
Availability Group Listener Resource Id
SQL virtual machine group name.
SQL virtual machine Group object.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzAvailabilityGroupListener -ResourceGroupName ResourceGroup01 -SqlVMGroupName SqlVmGroup01 -Name AgListener01

dev:remarks.maml:para: Name ResourceGroupName GroupName AvailabilityGroupName ---- ----------------- --------- --------------------- AgListener01 ResourceGroup01 SqlVmGroup01 AvailabilityGroup01
This command gets information about the Availability Group Listener AgListener01 in the SQL Virtual Machine Group SqlVmGroup01 and Resource Group ResourceGroup01.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzAvailabilityGroupListener -ResourceGroupName ResourceGroup01 -SqlVMGroupName SqlVmGroup01

dev:remarks.maml:para: Name ResourceGroupName GroupName AvailabilityGroupName ---- ----------------- --------- --------------------- AgListener01 ResourceGroup01 SqlVmGroup01 AvailabilityGroup01 AgListener02 ResourceGroup01 SqlVmGroup01 AvailabilityGroup01
This command gets information about all Availability Group Listeners in the SQL Virtual Machine Group SqlVmGroup01 and Resource Group ResourceGroup01.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $SqlVmGroupObject = Get-AzSqlVMGroup -ResourceGroupName ResourceGroup01 -SqlVMGroupName SqlVmGroup01 PS C:\> Get-AzAvailabilityGroupListener -Name AgListener01 -SqlVMGroupObject $SqlVmGroupObject

dev:remarks.maml:para: Name ResourceGroupName GroupName AvailabilityGroupName ---- ----------------- --------- --------------------- AgListener01 ResourceGroup01 SqlVmGroup01 AvailabilityGroup01

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more sql virtual machines.
The Get-AzSqlVM cmdlet gets one or more sql virtual machines.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the resource group.
SQL virtual machine name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The name of the resource group.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
SQL virtual machine resource id.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
SQL virtual machine name.
The name of the resource group.
SQL virtual machine resource id.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSqlVM
Name ResourceGroupName LicenseType Sku Offer SqlManagementType ---- ----------------- ----------- --- ----- ----------------- vm ResourceGroup01 PAYG Developer SQL2017-WS2016 Full vm2 ResourceGroup02 PAYG Developer SQL2017-WS2016 Full

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about all the Azure SQL virtual machines in the current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzSqlVM -ResourceGroupName "ResourceGroup01" Name ResourceGroupName LicenseType Sku Offer SqlManagementType ---- ----------------- ----------- --- ----- ----------------- vm ResourceGroup01 PAYG Developer SQL2017-WS2016 Full

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about all the Azure SQL virtual machines in the current subscription assigned to the resource group ResourceGroup01.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzSqlVM -ResourceGroupName "ResourceGroup01" -Name "vm" Name ResourceGroupName LicenseType Sku Offer SqlManagementType ---- ----------------- ----------- --- ----- ----------------- vm ResourceGroup01 PAYG Developer SQL2017-WS2016 Full

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about the SQL virtual machine "vm" assigned to the resource group ResourceGroup01.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets one or more sql virtual machine groups.
The Get-AzSqlVMGroup cmdlet gets one or more sql virtual machine groups.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the resource group.
SQL virtual machine group name.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The name of the resource group.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
SQL virtual machine group resource id.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
SQL virtual machine group name.
The name of the resource group.
SQL virtual machine group resource id.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzSqlVMGroup
Name ResourceGroupName Sku Offer ---- ----------------- --- ----- test-group ResourceGroup01 Developer SQL2017-WS2016 group1 ResourceGroup02 Developer SQL2017-WS2016

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about all the Azure SQL virtual machine groups in the current subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzSqlVMGroup -ResourceGroupName "ResourceGroup01" Name ResourceGroupName Sku Offer ---- ----------------- --- ----- test-group ResourceGroup01 Developer SQL2017-WS2016

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about all the Azure SQL virtual machine groups in the current subscription assigned to the resource group ResourceGroup01.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzSqlVMGroup -ResourceGroupName "ResourceGroup01" -Name "test-group" Name ResourceGroupName Sku Offer ---- ----------------- --- ----- test-group ResourceGroup01 Developer SQL2017-WS2016

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets information about the SQL virtual machine group "test-group" assigned to the resource group ResourceGroup01.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzAvailabilityGroupListener -AvailabilityGroupName AvailabilityGroup01 -LoadBalancerResourceId $LoadBalanceResourceId -SubnetId $SubnetId -ProbePort 59999 -SqlVirtualMachineId $VmResourceId1,$VmResourceId2 -Name AgListener01 -ResourceGroupName ResourceGroup01 -SqlVMGroupName SqlVmGroup01 -IpAddress 10.0.0.3

dev:remarks.maml:para: Name ResourceGroupName GroupName AvailabilityGroupName ---- ----------------- --------- --------------------- AgListener01 ResourceGroup01 SqlVmGroup01 AvailabilityGroup01
Creates a new Availability Group Listener AgListener01 for the Availability Group AvailabilityGroup01 in SQL Virtual Machine Group SqlVmGroup01.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new configuration for a sql virtual machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $config = New-AzSqlVMConfig -LicenseType "PAYG" PS C:\> New-AzSqlVM -ResourceGroupName "ResourceGroup01" -Name "vm" -SqlVM $config Name ResourceGroupName LicenseType Sku Offer SqlManagementType ---- ----------------- ----------- --- ----- ----------------- vm ResourceGroup01 PAYG Developer SQL2017-WS2016 Full

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a local configurable object of sql virtual machine that can be used in order to create an Azure sql virtual machine.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $secureKey = ConvertTo-SecureString $profile.StorageAccountPrimaryKey -AsPlainText -Force PS C:\> New-AzSqlVMGroup $resourceGroupName $groupName $location -ClusterOperatorAccount $profile.ClusterOperatorAccount ` >> -SqlServiceAccount $profile.SqlServiceAccount -StorageAccountUrl $profile.StorageAccountUrl ` >> -StorageAccountPrimaryKey $secureKey -DomainFqdn $profile.DomainFqdn ` >> -Offer 'SQL2017-WS2016' -Sku 'Developer' Name ResourceGroupName Sku Offer ---- ----------------- --- ----- test-group ResourceGroup01 Developer SQL2017-WS2016

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new Azure SQL virtual machine group with test-group vm in the resource group ResourceGroup01. $profile is an object of type Microsoft.Azure.Management.SqlVirtualMachine.Models.WsfcDomainProfile

maml:description.maml:para: Set the information relative to a sql virtual machine group in a sql virtual machine configuration.
The Set-AzSqlVMConfigGroup cmdlet set the information needed in order to join a sql virtual machine group for a sql virtual machine configuration.

maml:Description.maml:para: The SQL virtual machine configuration which group membership will be added to
The group the SQL virtual machine will be part of
Password for the cluster bootstrap account
Password for the cluster operator account

Password for the SQL service account
Password for the cluster bootstrap account
Password for the cluster operator account
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Password for the SQL service account
The SQL virtual machine configuration which group membership will be added to
The group the SQL virtual machine will be part of

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $config = Set-AzSqlVMConfigGroup -SqlVM $config -SqlVMGroup $group -ClusterOperatorAccountPassword 'password' -SqlServiceAccountPassword 'password'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Update the group informations of a sql virtual machine configuration.
